title: Thursday evening news briefing: UK and EU agree Brexit deal as Jean-Claude Juncker rules out another extension
text:
If you want to receive twice-daily briefings like this by email, sign up to the Front Page newsletter here and try our Audio Briefings on WhatsApp.

UK and EU agree Brexit deal as Juncker rules out extension

Many thought it wouldn't happen. Yet today the UK and EU agreed a new Brexit deal. That, believe it or not, is the easy part. Since this morning's announcementfrom Boris Johnson that a "great new deal has been done" the DUP has said it will "be unable to support" the proposal when MPs vote on it on Saturday. In another twist, Jean-Claude Juncker, the President of the European Commission, said there will be no extension past October 31. So it may well be a deal or no-deal vote for MPs after all. Get the latest updates on The Telegraph's liveblog.

So can Mr Johnson get his deal through Parliament without the support of the DUP? Patrick Scott has a series of graphs showing what needs to happen. And what does the Prime Minister's new Brexit deal mean for Northern Ireland and why is the DUP opposing it? James Rothwell has written the only piece you need to read. Plus, here is the DUP's statement in full. Meanwhile, Labour, the Lib Dems and the SNP have all said they will not support the agreement, with Nicola Sturgeon saying it justifies a second Scottish independence referendum.
